Name: Offering Table of Menefer and Ini-ankh
Description: Because this table was made of limestone, it was probably intended to hold solid and not liquid offerings. The table contains six small cavities in which offerings were placed by the family to sustain the owner of the table and his son in the afterlife. It has two lines of inscription that give the names and titles of the owner and his son, "The Honored One of the Great God, the Overseer of the Royal House, Menefer, his son, the Honored One of the Great God, the Overseer of the Royal House, Ini-ankh."
